summary: Twin Flames Across Time - Chapter Four
title: Twin Flames Across Time - Chapter Four
body:
It was the day I’d been waiting weeks for. Today was my last Friday before I started my eight week long paid time off.  All the extra nights and weekends of overtime had finally paid off and I had enough hours saved up to take six continuous weeks off with an extra two weeks of my annual leave for a combined total of eight weeks.  I was practically dancing to the elevator as I left my office.  Of course, even though I would be free from the stress-filled office, I promised to help Sam at the café which meant taking coffee and pastry orders but at least I would get a break from staring at computer screens all day.  I had planned to start my commute home when a text from Sam had me heading to the shop instead.  One of her few waitresses had called out and she needed someone to man the register while she baked more pastries.  

I arrived at the shop a few minutes after 6 p.m. to see the cafe was crowded.  A sea of people filled the shop including some of the regulars, among them an college student who stayed for hours doing homework, an elderly man and his friends who came in every few days for coffee and pastries and a group of moms who stopped in after their yoga classes to drink tea while they waited for their kids to get out of school.  

“Nic! I’m so glad you’re here! Grab an apron! I need some help getting these muffins into the oven!” Sam called to me from behind the register.  The apron she was wearing was covered in flour and what looked like coffee ground and chocolate sauce.  I could tell she was struggling so I grabbed an apron and joined her in the back.  “You won’t believe how many people are coming in and demanding chocolate muffins right now.  We’re sold out but they insist that they’ll wait the twenty minutes it’ll take for me to make more.  My arms hurt from how much batter I’ve had to mix for all this.  I still have to get through this rush and start prep for tomorrow.  It’s going to be a long night for me.  If you hadn’t come over, I think would have just started crying in the back.”  

“It’s fine, I was going to start coming in to help tomorrow anyway, this is just an early start to prepare me for the weekend rush. Besides, it’s nice to see some familiar faces out there.” I said as helped Sam lift a few trays of muffins into the oven. “How many muffins is this? This many could feed more than the whole crowd out there.”

“There’s twenty-four on each pan and fourteen pans so a little over three hundred muffins.  It should last us for the next few hours if not the whole night.  Thanks for helping me get these in the oven.  I think I can handle everything back here if you could help out in the front, I’m pretty sure we can make it through this rush.  Take these scones to William and his friends?”

I nodded and headed back out front with the plates of scones to deliver to William.  William and his friends were regulars at the shop that came in early some days and never seemed to leave.  They were an elderly group who met up and reminisced about their youth in the shop.  They always had stories about growing up in the 20s and always took the time to ask you after you.  It was kind of like having your grandfather around at the shop telling you stories and giving you advice.  I found William’s table outside and set the scones down on their table.  

“Nicole, what are you doing here? Sam using you for free labor again?” William joked as he reached for the scone in front of him.  

“You know Sam, if she could, she’d lock me in the back and never let me leave.  Who else can keep up with her books and help her bake everything? Are you guys out of coffee? Let me bring you some more, I’ll be right back.”  I turned to see a blonde man at the table next to William’s that I had never seen before drawing absently in a sketchbook and noticed his coffee cup was almost empty.  I went back inside and made sure the coffee pot was full before heading back out to refill the blonde man’s coffee cup as well as William’s and his friends but when I returned the blonde man was gone.  All that was left was his cup and a tip.  

~~~

The next morning found me back at the shop working the morning rush alongside Sam and another waitress named Christine.  Usually, I was on the customer buying coffee and bagel and wading through the crowd to pick up my order versus being the one yelling out orders into a sea of people hoping the right customer would hear me and come to counter.  

“Christine, can you grab more egg bagels from the back? We’re running low out here.” I called to her as she brought back two empty coffee pots.  We were packed for carry out orders and seated diners making things hectic to navigate.  

“You got it, Nicole, gimme a sec, I’ll be right back!” She took off towards the kitchen after setting more coffee to brew. “When those finish, can you set up some pots of black tea?” I yelled an affirmative and took the next customer’s order before heading to the beverage station to brew the tea for Christine. As I filled the tea kettle with water, I noticed through the window,  William and his friends take a seat at one of the tables outside and made a mental note to prepare their usual order for Christine to bring to them after I finished with the current customer rush.  

By the time we had finished with the morning rush, I had almost forgotten William and the other old-timers were outside and decided to take a moment to refill everyone’s coffee.  As I stepped outside, I noticed the blonde man was back.  As I got closer, I could see he was still drawing absently in a sketchbook.  I wondered what he could be drawing since he had a sad look on his face while glancing up at Stark Tower.  But before I could ask, William called out to me and I turned away to refill his group’s cups and help settle their debate on which pie was better, apple or blueberry?  

After the debate settled, I turned and noticed the blonde’s coffee was almost empty and knew this was my chance to start a conversation with him.  

“Waiting on the big guy?” I said as I approached his table.

“Ma’am?” The blonde man looked up at me with a look of confusion in his bright blue eyes.

“Iron Man. A lot of people eat here just to see him fly by.” He looked a little disgusted as I mentioned Iron Man. ‘Not a fan of Tony Stark then I guess.’

“Right, maybe another time.” He said as he reached for his wallet.

“The tables all yours as long as you like. Nobody’s waiting on it.” I reached over to fill

his cup, “Plus, we’ve got free wireless.” I said turning to head back inside.

“Radio?” The blonde man asked with a confused look on his face. I just gave him a small confused smile and went to the next table.

‘ Wireless Radio?’ I thought to myself, ‘Aren’t all radios wireless? Who carries radios anymore?’ I refilled another customers cup and headed back inside.

“Ask for her number, you moron.” I heard William say to the blonde man over his shoulder. I laughed to myself. It was just like William to intervene in other people’s lives. But I had to admit, I was curious about the blonde man. There’s no way a guy like him didn’t have a soulmate.

~~~

I dreamed again about Roger. He was still spending nights at the gym destroying punching bags. Except for this time, he was talking to himself.

“I can just go back tomorrow. Things are different now.” I wondered what he was talking about.

“I should have asked for her name.” ‘Asked her name? Whose?’

“You’re different now, you’re bigger than you used to be. You can ask a beautiful woman for her number or on a date now.”  ‘Ask a beautiful woman on a date? Is he planning to ask someone out? But doesn’t he know I exist?’ I felt hurt that I had waited this long to find my soulmate just to watch him make plans to ask another woman out. He had to know I existed right? Didn’t he see my life now? He had to if he stayed up this late, he had to sleep during the day when I was awake and heading to work. Maybe he was tired of waiting for me and was looking for a chosen mate instead? Of course, this would be my life.  

I jerked awake to the sound of my alarm going off.  I lay in bed for a minute contemplating how I felt about Roger asking another woman out on a date.  Maybe he couldn’t see me in his dreams. After all, I hadn’t seen him until now, maybe he doesn’t know I exist and is trying to be happy without a soulmate. I rolled out of bed and got dressed.  I could smell Rachel making coffee and headed out to the kitchen.  

“Hey Nic, why are you up so early? I thought you were off for the next few weeks?” Rachel called over her shoulder as she flipped her omelette.  

“I am but I’m helping Sam out until she can get things sorted out and hire a few more people to help out.”  I poured myself a cup of coffee and took a seat at the table.

“Oh yeah, how’s that going? I know things have been rough opening the shop since her grandparents passed.”

“It’s going well actually, the café is always packed in the morning and evening rush hours and she’s got some regulars.  It could just be because she just opened the shop but I believe it’s because of her family recipes. Remember her family’s apple pie recipe?” I paused to take a sip of coffee.  It was terrible, Rachel should stick to just making eggs.

“Her grandmother’s apple pie? It’s to die for! When you first brought some home, I thought it was going be generic diner pie like any other greasy spoon in New York but that pie was amazing!”  Rachel gushed while sliding her omelette to a plate.

“Yeah, she actually found her family’s recipe book with all of her family’s recipes going back a few generations.  All of the pastries they sell are from her family’s recipes and they are just as good as her grandmother’s pie. You should bring Mike by sometime to try it.” Rachel snorted.

“I don’t think Mike is going to believe anything is better than his grammy’s cooking. But maybe when the office isn’t so busy, we’ll stop by.  I feel like I barely see anyone besides my co-workers and my bed. I’m barely getting sleep these days. Speaking of sleep, have you had any dreams about Roger?” She asked starting to cut and eat her omelette.

“I… I don’t know.” I sighed.

“What do you mean you don’t know? Either you dreamed about him or you didn’t.” She said giving me a look.

“Well, I’ve been dreaming about him boxing at an old gym but I can’t tell where it is.”

“A boxing gym? That’s a start though. So a guy into World War 2 and hangs out at an old boxing gym. What’s wrong with that?”

“It’s just… last night, I had a dream, he was in the gym but he was talking to himself.” Rachel made a face. “No, not like that.  It sounded like he was trying to… I don’t know trying to build up the courage to ask another woman out on a date.” I said staring into my coffee cup.

“What?! Are you sure? Oh Nic, I’m sorry.  I know how long you’ve been waiting to find out if you had a soulmate and now this.”  She got up hugged me. “What are you going to do? Do you just want to wait and see if you cross paths or do you want to try to find him?”

I hesitated, “I think I want… to try to find him.  I’ve waited this long and I gave up on even having a soul mate. Now, I know I have one and it’s been months since I found out.  I should start looking for him. Maybe he’s going out with someone else because he’s seen that I’m not looking for him.  Maybe he thinks that because I’m not looking for him, I’m not interested in him.  After I finish helping Sam at the café, I’m going to spend the rest of my time-off looking for him.”

“Nic, that’s great! You know I’ll help you right? I’m amazing at finding everyone’s secret Facebook page.  If he’s on social media, I’ll find him.  I’ll find out everything about him.  Maybe we can find him and watch him from afar to see if he’s crazy or not.”  I shot her a look, “Hey, you said he was talking to himself, hangs out in an old boxing gym and has a vintage army suit.  He could be cool but you have to admit that’s a little weird. But, I’ll see you when I get back, I have to get to the office early today. Let me know when we can start The Hunt so I know when to start digging into him! Bye!” She said grabbing her bag and darting out the front door.

I sat at the table for a few minutes before pulling my phone from my pocket.  Who was Roger? I didn’t even have a last name. I mean, his first name was muffled when I heard it, I could even have his first name wrong.  Should I check the soulmate forums? I didn’t have much to go on aside from his vintage army suit and late night boxing workouts and that could be anyone in New York City.  I mulled it over for a few more minutes before pulling up a soulmate forum and writing a post.  

‘Looking for my soulmate in New York City.  You probably thought you were going to be alone forever.  I know you frequent the gym late at night to box and have a vintage collection of military suits.  If you’ve seen me in your dreams, you know I work with numbers for a living. Message me, if you know what branch of the military the suits are from and where I work.’

Was it too vague or too revealing? It’s true any guy in the city could go boxing late at night, but how many also collected vintage army suits and had an accountant soulmate?  Besides, if Roger had seen me in his dreams, the name of my firm was everywhere in my office, he had to know the name of the firm where I worked.  Hopefully, I’d get a response or at least could weed out the creeps who used the website to scam people looking for their soulmate.  

I stared at the forum on my phone before tossing it on the table.  I guess all there was to do now was wait.

“There’s twenty-four on each pan and fourteen pans so a little over three hundred muffins.  It should last us for the next few hours if not the whole night.  Thanks for helping me get these in the oven.  I think I can handle everything back here if you could help out in the front, I’m pretty sure we can make it through this rush.  Take these scones to William and his friends?”

I nodded and headed back out front with the plates of scones to deliver to William.  William and his friends were regulars at the shop that came in early some days and never seemed to leave.  They were an elderly group who met up and reminisced about their youth in the shop.  They always had stories about growing up in the 20s and always took the time to ask you after you.  It was kind of like having your grandfather around at the shop telling you stories and giving you advice.  I found William’s table outside and set the scones down on their table.  

“Nicole, what are you doing here? Sam using you for free labor again?” William joked as he reached for the scone in front of him.  

“You know Sam, if she could, she’d lock me in the back and never let me leave.  Who else can keep up with her books and help her bake everything? Are you guys out of coffee? Let me bring you some more, I’ll be right back.”  I turned to see a blonde man at the table next to William’s that I had never seen before drawing absently in a sketchbook and noticed his coffee cup was almost empty.  I went back inside and made sure the coffee pot was full before heading back out to refill the blonde man’s coffee cup as well as William’s and his friends but when I returned the blonde man was gone.  All that was left was his cup and a tip.  

~~~

The next morning found me back at the shop working the morning rush alongside Sam and another waitress named Christine.  Usually, I was on the customer buying coffee and bagel and wading through the crowd to pick up my order versus being the one yelling out orders into a sea of people hoping the right customer would hear me and come to counter.  

“Christine, can you grab more egg bagels from the back? We’re running low out here.” I called to her as she brought back two empty coffee pots.  We were packed for carry out orders and seated diners making things hectic to navigate.  

“You got it, Nicole, gimme a sec, I’ll be right back!” She took off towards the kitchen after setting more coffee to brew. “When those finish, can you set up some pots of black tea?” I yelled an affirmative and took the next customer’s order before heading to the beverage station to brew the tea for Christine. As I filled the tea kettle with water, I noticed through the window,  William and his friends take a seat at one of the tables outside and made a mental note to prepare their usual order for Christine to bring to them after I finished with the current customer rush.  

By the time we had finished with the morning rush, I had almost forgotten William and the other old-timers were outside and decided to take a moment to refill everyone’s coffee.  As I stepped outside, I noticed the blonde man was back.  As I got closer, I could see he was still drawing absently in a sketchbook.  I wondered what he could be drawing since he had a sad look on his face while glancing up at Stark Tower.  But before I could ask, William called out to me and I turned away to refill his group’s cups and help settle their debate on which pie was better, apple or blueberry?  

After the debate settled, I turned and noticed the blonde’s coffee was almost empty and knew this was my chance to start a conversation with him.  

“Waiting on the big guy?” I said as I approached his table.

“Ma’am?” The blonde man looked up at me with a look of confusion in his bright blue eyes.

“Iron Man. A lot of people eat here just to see him fly by.” He looked a little disgusted as I mentioned Iron Man. ‘Not a fan of Tony Stark then I guess.’

“Right, maybe another time.” He said as he reached for his wallet.

“The tables all yours as long as you like. Nobody’s waiting on it.” I reached over to fill

his cup, “Plus, we’ve got free wireless.” I said turning to head back inside.

“Radio?” The blonde man asked with a confused look on his face. I just gave him a small confused smile and went to the next table.

‘ Wireless Radio?’ I thought to myself, ‘Aren’t all radios wireless? Who carries radios anymore?’ I refilled another customers cup and headed back inside.

“Ask for her number, you moron.” I heard William say to the blonde man over his shoulder. I laughed to myself. It was just like William to intervene in other people’s lives. But I had to admit, I was curious about the blonde man. There’s no way a guy like him didn’t have a soulmate.

~~~

I dreamed again about Roger. He was still spending nights at the gym destroying punching bags. Except for this time, he was talking to himself.

“I can just go back tomorrow. Things are different now.” I wondered what he was talking about.

“I should have asked for her name.” ‘Asked her name? Whose?’

“You’re different now, you’re bigger than you used to be. You can ask a beautiful woman for her number or on a date now.”  ‘Ask a beautiful woman on a date? Is he planning to ask someone out? But doesn’t he know I exist?’ I felt hurt that I had waited this long to find my soulmate just to watch him make plans to ask another woman out. He had to know I existed right? Didn’t he see my life now? He had to if he stayed up this late, he had to sleep during the day when I was awake and heading to work. Maybe he was tired of waiting for me and was looking for a chosen mate instead? Of course, this would be my life.  

I jerked awake to the sound of my alarm going off.  I lay in bed for a minute contemplating how I felt about Roger asking another woman out on a date.  Maybe he couldn’t see me in his dreams. After all, I hadn’t seen him until now, maybe he doesn’t know I exist and is trying to be happy without a soulmate. I rolled out of bed and got dressed.  I could smell Rachel making coffee and headed out to the kitchen.  

“Hey Nic, why are you up so early? I thought you were off for the next few weeks?” Rachel called over her shoulder as she flipped her omelette.  

“I am but I’m helping Sam out until she can get things sorted out and hire a few more people to help out.”  I poured myself a cup of coffee and took a seat at the table.

“Oh yeah, how’s that going? I know things have been rough opening the shop since her grandparents passed.”

“It’s going well actually, the café is always packed in the morning and evening rush hours and she’s got some regulars.  It could just be because she just opened the shop but I believe it’s because of her family recipes. Remember her family’s apple pie recipe?” I paused to take a sip of coffee.  It was terrible, Rachel should stick to just making eggs.

“Her grandmother’s apple pie? It’s to die for! When you first brought some home, I thought it was going be generic diner pie like any other greasy spoon in New York but that pie was amazing!”  Rachel gushed while sliding her omelette to a plate.

“Yeah, she actually found her family’s recipe book with all of her family’s recipes going back a few generations.  All of the pastries they sell are from her family’s recipes and they are just as good as her grandmother’s pie. You should bring Mike by sometime to try it.” Rachel snorted.

“I don’t think Mike is going to believe anything is better than his grammy’s cooking. But maybe when the office isn’t so busy, we’ll stop by.  I feel like I barely see anyone besides my co-workers and my bed. I’m barely getting sleep these days. Speaking of sleep, have you had any dreams about Roger?” She asked starting to cut and eat her omelette.

“I… I don’t know.” I sighed.

“What do you mean you don’t know? Either you dreamed about him or you didn’t.” She said giving me a look.

“Well, I’ve been dreaming about him boxing at an old gym but I can’t tell where it is.”

“A boxing gym? That’s a start though. So a guy into World War 2 and hangs out at an old boxing gym. What’s wrong with that?”

“It’s just… last night, I had a dream, he was in the gym but he was talking to himself.” Rachel made a face. “No, not like that.  It sounded like he was trying to… I don’t know trying to build up the courage to ask another woman out on a date.” I said staring into my coffee cup.

“What?! Are you sure? Oh Nic, I’m sorry.  I know how long you’ve been waiting to find out if you had a soulmate and now this.”  She got up hugged me. “What are you going to do? Do you just want to wait and see if you cross paths or do you want to try to find him?”

I hesitated, “I think I want… to try to find him.  I’ve waited this long and I gave up on even having a soul mate. Now, I know I have one and it’s been months since I found out.  I should start looking for him. Maybe he’s going out with someone else because he’s seen that I’m not looking for him.  Maybe he thinks that because I’m not looking for him, I’m not interested in him.  After I finish helping Sam at the café, I’m going to spend the rest of my time-off looking for him.”

“Nic, that’s great! You know I’ll help you right? I’m amazing at finding everyone’s secret Facebook page.  If he’s on social media, I’ll find him.  I’ll find out everything about him.  Maybe we can find him and watch him from afar to see if he’s crazy or not.”  I shot her a look, “Hey, you said he was talking to himself, hangs out in an old boxing gym and has a vintage army suit.  He could be cool but you have to admit that’s a little weird. But, I’ll see you when I get back, I have to get to the office early today. Let me know when we can start The Hunt so I know when to start digging into him! Bye!” She said grabbing her bag and darting out the front door.

I sat at the table for a few minutes before pulling my phone from my pocket.  Who was Roger? I didn’t even have a last name. I mean, his first name was muffled when I heard it, I could even have his first name wrong.  Should I check the soulmate forums? I didn’t have much to go on aside from his vintage army suit and late night boxing workouts and that could be anyone in New York City.  I mulled it over for a few more minutes before pulling up a soulmate forum and writing a post.  

‘Looking for my soulmate in New York City.  You probably thought you were going to be alone forever.  I know you frequent the gym late at night to box and have a vintage collection of military suits.  If you’ve seen me in your dreams, you know I work with numbers for a living. Message me, if you know what branch of the military the suits are from and where I work.’

Was it too vague or too revealing? It’s true any guy in the city could go boxing late at night, but how many also collected vintage army suits and had an accountant soulmate?  Besides, if Roger had seen me in his dreams, the name of my firm was everywhere in my office, he had to know the name of the firm where I worked.  Hopefully, I’d get a response or at least could weed out the creeps who used the website to scam people looking for their soulmate.  

I stared at the forum on my phone before tossing it on the table.  I guess all there was to do now was wait.

“Nic! I’m so glad you’re here! Grab an apron! I need some help getting these muffins into the oven!” Sam called to me from behind the register.  The apron she was wearing was covered in flour and what looked like coffee ground and chocolate sauce.  I could tell she was struggling so I grabbed an apron and joined her in the back.  “You won’t believe how many people are coming in and demanding chocolate muffins right now.  We’re sold out but they insist that they’ll wait the twenty minutes it’ll take for me to make more.  My arms hurt from how much batter I’ve had to mix for all this.  I still have to get through this rush and start prep for tomorrow.  It’s going to be a long night for me.  If you hadn’t come over, I think would have just started crying in the back.”  

“It’s fine, I was going to start coming in to help tomorrow anyway, this is just an early start to prepare me for the weekend rush. blog.description: Kat | 24 | cat mom | fangirl | reblogger of fanfiction | also attempts writing her own | main masterlist

title: 30 Days of Avengers One-Shots - Masterlist
body:
Summary: Welcome to the masterlist for my NaNoWriMo 2k18 project! Every day I will be writing a new Avengers-related one-shot that is at least the daily word count (1667 words) in length. All will be reader inserts.

Total Chapters: 30

Series warnings: Fluff, angst, battle, graphic nightmare, panic attack, various shenanigans tagged in individual fics

Author’s note: This is going to be fun! Drabble requests will be put off for the month but I’ll still be taking one-shot requests. All fics will be posted near the end of the day AKDT since I’ll be writing them the day I post them and in the spirit of NaNoWriMo will be mostly unedited. To maintain my sanity, all my current WIPs will be on hiatus for the month. Also, all credit for the photos on each fic goes to the wonderful photographers who post their stuff on Unsplash.

——————–

Chapters:

November 1 - Tony Touches Something He Shouldn’t (Or: How Steve Kind of Ends Up with a Gladiator Girlfriend)

November 2 - I Told You She Likes You (Steve Rogers X Reader Highschool!AU)

November 3 - In Which the Worst Day Is Made Better (Comic!Clint Barton X Reader)

November 4 - Sir Could Use Some Help (Platonic!Tony Stark X Employee!Reader) - CONTAINS PANIC ATTACK

November 5 - Five Firsts with Bucky Barnes 

November 6 - Chasing Stars (Steve Rogers X Reader - CONTAINS GRAPHIC NIGHTMARE)

November 7 - Save the Last Dance (40s!Bucky Barnes X Reader)

November 8 - Always a Child (De-Aged!Tony Stark X Reader)

November 9 - The Little Things (Bucky Barnes X Reader)

November 10 - I Wish… (Jinn!Loki X Reader)

November 11 - The Amulet of Sisters (Spider-Man X Reader)

November 12 - Of Royals and Robots (Prince!Tony Stark X Reader)

November 13 - Sing It Out (Steve Rogers X Reader)

November 14 - We’re Gonna Go Flirt with Superheroes (Bucky Barnes X Reader ft. my friend Dean)

November 15 - The Chibi Falcon (Sam Wilson X Reader)

November 16 - Best Birthday Ever (Steve Rogers X Reader)

November 17 - Falling Slowly (Tony Stark X Reader Highschool!AU)

November 18 - Your Love Is A Song (Steve Rogers X Reader - Sequel to Sing It Out)

November 19 - Special Plans (Bucky Barnes X Rogers!Reader with Brother!Steve - Modern!AU)

November 20 - Haiku Can Be Hard, But Not As Hard As Saying, How Much I Like You (Clint Barton X Reader - Modern!AU)

November 21 - First Date (Clint Barton X Reader - Sequel to “Haiku…”)

November 22 - A Tingle and an Itch (Tony Stark X Reader - Soulmate!AU)

November 23 - Liquid Perfection (Bucky Barnes X Reader - Coffee Shop!AU)

November 24 - Second Opinion (Loki X Reader Drabble)

November 25 - I’m Blaming You (Sam Wilson X Reader Drabble)

November 26 - The Lie (Steve Rogers X Reader Drabble)

November 27 - Hacker (Tony Stark X Reader)

November 28 - Reference Questions of Questionable Importance (Librarian!Bruce Banner X Reader - Modern!AU)

November 29 - Vacation in the Vents (Clint Barton X Reader)

November 30 - Beautiful Wings (Bucky Barnes X Reader - Wingsfic)

trail.content_raw:
Summary: Welcome to the masterlist for my NaNoWriMo 2k18 project! Every day I will be writing a new Avengers-related one-shot that is at least the daily word count (1667 words) in length. All will be reader inserts.

Total Chapters: 30

Series warnings: Fluff, angst, battle, graphic nightmare, panic attack, various shenanigans tagged in individual fics

Author’s note: This is going to be fun! Drabble requests will be put off for the month but I’ll still be taking one-shot requests. All fics will be posted near the end of the day AKDT since I’ll be writing them the day I post them and in the spirit of NaNoWriMo will be mostly unedited. To maintain my sanity, all my current WIPs will be on hiatus for the month. Also, all credit for the photos on each fic goes to the wonderful photographers who post their stuff on Unsplash.

——————–
